title: PHPvar_dump()Function

metadata.description: Learn about PHPvar_dump()Function with clear explanations and practical examples.

content_sections.title: Details
content_sections.content:
Example Dump information about different variables: "; $b = "Hello world!"; echo var_dump($b) . "
"; $c = 32.5; echo var_dump($c) . "
"; $d = array("red", "green", "blue"); echo var_dump($d) . "
"; $e = array(32, "Hello world!", 32.5, array("red", "green", "blue")); echo var_dump($e) . "
"; // Dump two variables echo var_dump($a, $b) . "
"; ?> Definition and Usage The var_dump() function dumps information about one or more variables. The information holds type and value of the variable(s). Syntax var_dump( var1 , var2 , ...); Parameter Values Parameter Description var1 , var2 , ... Required. Specifies the variable(s) to dump information from Technical Details Return Value: Nothing Return Type: - PHP Version: 4.0+ ★ +1

content_sections.title: Example
content_sections.code:
"; $b = "Hello world!"; echo var_dump($b) . "
"; $c = 32.5; echo var_dump($c) . "
"; $d = array("red", "green", "blue"); echo var_dump($d) . "
"; $e = array(32, "Hello world!", 32.5, array("red", "green", "blue")); echo var_dump($e) . "
"; // Dump two variables echo var_dump($a, $b) . "
"; ?>

summary: This tutorial covers PHPvar_dump()Function concepts and techniques. You'll learn how to use PHPvar_dump()Function effectively, including key principles, common patterns, and practical examples. By the end of this tutorial, you'll have a solid understanding of PHPvar_dump()Function and how to apply it in your projects.
